item.description:
This new Visual Studio 2022 v17.13 features is absolutely mind blowing enabling you to completely live preview, make edits and changes, and seem updated in your app without having to debug your application at all! This is a crazy new feature that speeds up development and help you iterate faster!

item.title: Tracking Every Change: Using SaveChanges Interception for EF Core Auditing - Chris Woody Woodruff
item.description: Ever wonder who changed what and when in your database? Or maybe you’ve had that “uh-oh” moment where data was updated, but no one knows how? Good news: EF Core has a built-in way to track changes—without modifying every query manually! SaveChanges Interception lets you hook into EF Core’s SaveChanges() pipeline and log inserts, updates, and deletes automatically.

Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, I will introduce you to what I think is one of the most underrated .NET features of all-time, and that is Channels. I believe that every .NET developer should know how to use them.

item.description:
In Category C: Planning & Game Design, I talk about topics to consider when coming up with game ideas and mechanics. These are good things to keep in mind when thinking of new game concepts.
[Index] 0:00 Opening 0:11 C-27 In-Game Cutscenes 3:11 C-28 Start with the Climax 5:58 C-29 Being Kind to Beginners 8:54 C-30 Be Mindful of the Time Players are Giving You

item.title: How come not everyone is an Angel Investor? - Blog - Peter Zaitsev
item.description: Personally, I love Angel Investing! Not only does it provide an opportunity for outsized returns (if you’re making good choices) but also, compared to being LP in the early-stage Venture Fund it often allows you to have a direct line to founders, which tends to be awesome, and an opportunity to contribute to business success.  […]

item.title: The European Accessibility Act for websites and apps by Martijn Hols
item.description: Learn how the European Accessibility Act (EAA) impacts websites and apps, key accessibility requirements, deadlines, and tips to prepare for compliance.

item.title: DeepSeek-R1's strong zero-shot performance on agentic tasks
item.description: I ran a quick experiment investigating how DeepSeek-R1 performs on agentic tasks, despite not supporting tool use natively, and I was quite impressed by preliminary results. This experiment runs DeepSeek-R1 in a single-agent setup, where the model not only plans the actions but also formulates the actions as executable Python code. On a subset1 of the GAIA validation split, DeepSeek-R1 outperforms Claude 3.5 Sonnet by 12.5% absolute, from 53.1% to 65.6% correct, and other models by an even larger margin:
